title: Sins of Colonialism - Collection 12 (.. in the Americas 4)
description:
Sins of Colonialism - Collection 12 (.. in the Americas 4):

We have 35 titles here:

-  Bachman - Death and Violence on the Reservation; Homicide, Family Violence, and Suicide in American Indian Populations (1992)

-  Calloway - The Victory with No Name; the Native American Defeat of the First American Army (2015)

-  Castillo - The True History of the Conquest of New Spain (2012)

-  Cave - Lethal Encounters; Englishmen and Indians in Colonial Virginia (2011)

-  Churchill - Perversions of Justice; Indigenous Peoples and Angloamerican Law (2003)

-  Churchill - Since Predator Came; Notes from the Struggle for American Indian Liberation (1995)

-  Churchill - Struggle for the Land; Native North American Resistance to Genocide, Ecocide and Colonization (2002)

-  Clayton - Bartolome de las Casas and the Conquest of the Americas (2011)

-  Cothran - Remembering the Modoc War; Redemptive Violence and the Making of American Innocence (2014)

-  De Las Casas - A Short Account of the Destruction of the Indies (1992)

-  Ethridge - From Chcaza to Chickasaw; the European Invasion and the Transformation of the Mississippian World, 1540-1715 (2010)

-  Grady - Anglo-Spanish Rivalry in Colonial South-East America, 1650-1725 (2010)

-  Greene & Scott - Finding Sand Creek; History, Archeology, and the 1864 Massacre Site (2004)

-  Hixson - American Settler Colonialism; a History (2013)

-  Lookingbill - War Dance at Fort Marion; Plains Indian War Prisoners (2006)

-  McNickle - Native American Tribalism; Indian Survivals and Renewals (1993)

-  Moore - The Dream Shall Have a Name; Native Americans Rewriting America (2013)

-  Parker - The Sugar Barons; Family, Corruption, Empire, and War in the West Indies (2011)

-  Pitt - Body, Nation, and Narrative in the Americas (2010)

-  Power-Greene - Against Wind and Tide; the African American Struggle Against the Colonization Movement (2014)

-  Restall & Fernandez-Armesto - The Conquistadors; a Very Short Introduction (2012)

-  Robinson - The Plains Wars, 1757-1900 (2003)

-  Rosen - American Indians and State Law; Sovereignty, Race, and Citizenship, 1790-1880 (2007)

-  Sepulveda - Industrial Colonialism in Latin America; the Third Stage (2013)

-  Solnit - Savage Dreams; a Journey into the Hidden Wars of the American West (1994, 2014)

-  Stannard - American Holocaust; Columbus and the Conquest of the New World (1992)

-  Starna - From Homeland to New Land; a History of the Mahican Indians, 1600-1830 (2013)

-  Tate - Indians and Emigrants; Encounters on the Overland Trails (2006)

-  Thomas - Conquest; Montezuma, Cortes, and the Fall of Old Mexico (1993)

-  Thornton - American Indian Holocaust and Survival; a Population History Since 1492 (1987)

-  Vestal - Warpath; the True Story of the Fighting Sioux Told in a Biography of Chief White Bull (1984)

-  Wheeler - To Live Upon Hope; Mohicans and Missionaries in the Eighteenth-Century Northeast (2008)

-  Zappia - Traders and Raiders; the Indigenous World of the Colorado Basin, 1540-1859 (2014)

-  Zimmerman - Saga of the Sioux (2011)
